chargeHist.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle R. Knopes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Court granted Sentence Modification on 08/02/2017.  See Order Concerning Sentence Modification filed on Aug 2, 2017.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle R. Knopes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Term of confinement in prison and term of extended supervision shall be adjusted pursuant to Sec. 302.113(9g)(f), Wis. Stats.  The total length of defendant's bifurcated sentence is not changed.

2:29 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Kyle R. Knopes, by VIDEO from Dodge Correction, with Atty Aileen Henry.  
Matter is before the Court for hearing on DOC's Petition with regard to a request to release deft from the initial confinement portion of his sentence and convert it to extended supervision.  Court has reviewed the file including all materials utilized by the Court at sentencing.  Court has reviewed the documents filed by DOC.  
2:32 pm  Atty Wiedenfeld is not objecting to the modification and believes Court could make necessary findings and grant the Petition.   
2:33 pm  Response by Atty Henry.  
2:33 pm  Court makes record that Mr. Knopes has an extraordinary health condition which will not improve.  He needs care for every aspect of his life.  The burden of proof is by the defendant and Court does find that defendant has met that burden.  DOC and his family have insured that he will not have any kind of Internet or computer access.  Court finds it is not against public interests to the community or nor is there a threat of him committing new crimes.  Court modifies sentence such that his total sentence will be converted to only being extended supervision and he must be released within 30 days of this hearing.  All conditions of ES shall remain in full force and effect.  Court will add the following condition of extended supervision.  "For the next year (starting on date of release from the prison), he cannot leave his home other than for medical or health related appointments or for treatment/counseling as ordered by his Agent."  
2:41 Atty Wiedenfeld makes record as to compliance victims rights - to the extent possible.  
2:42 pm  Court in recess.

Sentencing Hearing before the Honorable Judge Kristine Drettwan on February 16, 2017
Court Reporter Leslie Johnson
letter from DOC re: Petition to Modify Bifurcated Sentence
Petition to  Modify Bifurcated Sentence
of Sentencing Hearing held 2/16/17
Temporary Commitment form filed

10:31 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given. 
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Kyle R. Knopes in court with Atty Aileen Henry.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Court recites charge and maximum potential penalty.  Court notes that sentencing was put over from last September and the defense had filed a Motion as to whether this was a 3 year mandatory minimum sentence case.  Court makes record as to the decisions of the Appellate Courts.  Response by Atty Henry to Court's question with regard to the Appellate Court decisions.  Court makes record with regard to the images.  Court has reviewed the entire file including the PSI that was prepared and filed, Dr. Jurik's evaluation, the materials in the court file as well as all of the materials that were submitted by the defendant's family and friends.  Atty Henry has no additions or corrections to the PSI and has reviewed it with Mr. Knopes.    
10:39 am  Statement by Penny Knopes, mother.  
10:39 am  Atty Wiedenfeld advises that the State is in compliance with victims rights.  Argument as to sentence by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
10:49 am  Atty Henry makes record as to one issue she wishes to address at the bottom of page 2 of the PSI - under the "other statements" section.  She wanted to present some context to that statement.  
10:58 am  Mr. Knopes does not wish to make a statement.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
Total length of sentence:  6 years prison
3 year IC followed by 3 yrs ES
NOT eligible for CIP or SAP
No sentence credit.  

1)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
2)  No access to or use of computers.  
3)  Enter into and successfully complete sex offender treatment or any other recommended treatment.  
4)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
5)  Register as a sex offender and comply with sex offender registry.  
6)  No contact with any minors unless approved by the Agent. 

Court gives warnings:  1)  Cannot vote until civil rights are restored;  2)  Cannot possess firearms;  3)  Cannot possess body armor;  4)  Cannot work or volunteer with children;  

11:17 am  Court in recess.
